  physical_appearance: This is a compilation of bugle calls for the Ceylon Rifle Regiment. The cover of the book is brown
 with strips of red along its spine as well as on the top and bottom right corners.

  sgcool_label_text: The Ceylon Rifle Regiment (CRR) was a regular native regiment formed by the British in Ceylon in 1795
 when five independent companies of Malays were transferred from the Dutch to the British East India Company service. This manuscript
 dated 1856
 compiles the bugle calls for 113 military commands
 each with musical notation and explanatory remarks in English
 Malay and Tamil. It was compiled by Ensign William Guy of the CRR
 and was directed to native and non-commissioned officers of the Regiment. The bugle calls were divided into ‘regulation sounds’
 daily barrack sounds’ and ‘miscellaneous sounds’.

metadata.title_text: Compilation of bugle calls for the Ceylon Rifle Regiment
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a compilation of bugle calls for the Ceylon Rifle Regiment. The cover of the book is brown, with strips of red along its spine as well as on the top and bottom right corners.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Ensign William Guy Musical notation Bugle calls East India Company
metadata.sgcool_label_text: The Ceylon Rifle Regiment (CRR) was a regular native regiment formed by the British in Ceylon in 1795, when five independent companies of Malays were transferred from the Dutch to the British East India Company service. This manuscript, dated 1856, compiles the bugle calls for 113 military commands, each with musical notation and explanatory remarks in English, Malay and Tamil. It was compiled by Ensign William Guy of the CRR, and was directed to native and non-commissioned officers of the Regiment. The bugle calls were divided into ‘regulation sounds’, daily barrack sounds’ and ‘miscellaneous sounds’.
